name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Merced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Merced because of its location between San Francisco and Yosemite. It was 2 hours from San Francisco and 1 1/2 hours to Yosemite. The Hotel is very nice. The complimentary breakfast was more than expected. The only problem we had was when we were using the business center and made tour reservation that could only be printed once and the printer would not work. I went to the front desk and she said she has asked to get it fixed, but has not been done yet. I advised her she should put a sign on the printer letting others know that it is out of order. I had to redo our tour reservations and wait for a refund for the first request. The rooms are very roomy and clean. Noise was not an issue when sleeping. The wi-fi signal was not very good for our Ipad, so we used a wired computer. Would definetel use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Wonderful location to tour Northern CA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had the opportunity to stay at the Holiday Inn Express in Merced or the neighboring Hampton Inn. Both had great rates and since we frequently stay at Holiday Inn Express we opted for it.
reviews.title: Would NOT recommend!

reviews.text: Check-in person was helpful and knowledgable. Room was fine. Standard, clean, quiet, etc. I could not get connected to the free wifi and was too tired to spend the time working at it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: HOWEVER, next morning when we went for breakfast, it was chaos with about 30 people seated at the tables and another 30 standing around looking for food. They were out of food...at 8:45AM on a Sunday, including coffee and hot water for the one package of instant oatmeal that was available. Hostess was sweeping in the lobby and informed us that manager had gone for more food but since it was already 8:45AM, may not return before the scheduled 10AM closing of breakfast area.
reviews.title: Terrific customer service

reviews.text: In the meantime, we observed another staff member take a suitcase (concealed in large cardboard) to the trash area. The individual proceeded to empty the suitcase piece by piece, putting most contents in the trash area but some in their own pocket and finally throw the suitcase in the back of a pickup truck (presumably the employees). We tried to contact the manager as we thought this was extremely suspicious but even after 10AM when the manager had supposedly returned from "the food run", she could still not be located. We reported the incident to the competent front desk person who promised to follow up with the manager as we had to get back on the road. Although we left our cell phone number, no one ever followed up to clarify the situation or ask questions. All-in-all a very strange situation at this hotel. Normally I would recommend a Holiday Inn Express for a roadtrip but not this particular hotel!
reviews.title: We love this place

reviews.text: Great experience from beginning to end. Rooms are spacious, clean and live up to ones expectations. The front desk staff could not have been nicer or more accomodating. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel or recommend to my friends and family. Do yourself a favor and book your room here.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night on our way to yosemitee.
reviews.title: Great value, large room w/ great shower, great breakfast

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Perfect stop for Yosemite

reviews.text: Good value, not expensive for what you get.
reviews.title: Decent, clean, comfy, good value - all you need, really

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very large room.
reviews.title: Reasonably priced accommodation

reviews.text: Very clean and quiet room and hotel location. King room was actually larger than expected. The fitness room has an elliptical, stationary bike and treadmill. This HIE is about 15-20 minutes from the UC Merced campus. .
reviews.title: Great stay at the HI Express, Merced

reviews.text: We were in town for a mini family reunion and choose a hotel where the girls could spend a few hours in the pool. We were pleasantly greeted by Andrea when we checked in. Once we walked into our room we were pleasently surprised at how nice it was. The hotel was very clean, fresh and no sighs of need for repair. The breakfast stayed fully stocked, the pool and pool facilities were very nice and clean.
reviews.title: Loved it and will make this our hotel of choice when coming to visit every year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose the Holiday Inn Express in Merced after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, which ranks this hotel as #1 in Merced, and I have to agree. this is a newer property and is still in excellent condition and the neighborhood is a safe-feeling place too.
reviews.title: Tripadvisor is right again #1 in Merced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived about 10pm and check-in was smooth and friendly and I received exactly what I had reserved on line at the hotel's website.
reviews.title: We liked this Hotel

reviews.text: The room was clean, had a big-screen TV, nice mattresses, clean linens, plenty of pillows, and was spacious as well. the bathroom was a good size, and had good amenities. there was a coffee maker in the room although I didn't use it.
reviews.title: Long overdue

reviews.text: I stayed here to visit Yosemite National Park. I had never stayed in a Holiday Inn Express but must say I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was modern and clean, and my room was relatively large with a nice modern bathroom. The free breakfast was great with both hot and cold items. There is an outdoor pool and spa. The fitness room was a little lacking, having no weight equipment, only treadmills. The business center had fast (for a hotel) pcs. The location is quite a ways from Yosemite, as well from many restaurants (other than fast food). There is one upscale Italian restaurant nearby. To get a SD card for my camera I had to go to a Target in the center of Mereced which was about 5 miles away. The hotel is close to rt 99 which is good, but being the signage is poor at the highway exit, I made a wrong turn and it took a while for me to get to the hotel the first time. The residential area to the north also is a bit questionable, so take care if driving through there. I highly recommend the Castle Air Museum which is about 10 miles north of the hotel off 99 in Atwater for those that love seeing historic WWII planes and early jets. For a $10 fee it is well worth the trip.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: On our way back from Yosemite to San Francisco, we took a break and halted one night at this hotel. It is nice and clean and serves minimal but adequate breakfast. There are a couple of good restaurants within walking distance for a choice of different dinner options. It gives free internet connectivity.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: This is one of the best if not the best Holiday Inn Express hotels that we have ever stayed at. Great super clean and quiet rooms, and friendly staff. The morning breakfast was more than expected, and was of good taste and quality. Great meeting area to associate with friends
reviews.title: First Class Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after a one-day trip to Yosemite. The hotel is spotlessly clean, rooms fresh and bedding clean, large room, large bathroom. Very comfortable. Windows that open, which is nice. Everybody who worked at the hotel was very nice, very helpful. The pool area was clean and well-maintained. There are a couple of restaurants within "walking" distance, but we were advised by a hotel employee to avoid the large abandoned building and surrounding property, so we drove. The negative was that it is located right next to Highway 99 and it was so noisy it was impossible to sleep. Cannot comment on the breakfast buffet as we left before it was served. This is a great little hotel for a one-night stay, but it is not a destination hotel. It's clean, well-run, and is fine for a stopover.
reviews.title: Very clean, not a destination
SUPER HOTEL!
reviews.text: An excellent one night stopover hotel on the way from San Francisco to Yosemite Park. Our experience of the Holiday Inn Express chain has always been good and this well situated, impressive looking hotel in Merced was no exception. We received a warm welcome at reception and were given advice re. local restaurants. Our room was spacious, quiet, very clean and well decorated and comfortably furnished. With a good standard complimentary breakfast we would thoroughly recommend it as very good value for money.

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hotel And Suites Merced
description: Immerse yourself in the new fresh look and feel of our Holiday Inn Express and Suites in Merced, CA located at the intersection of Highways 140, 59 and California Highway 99. We are just a short distance from Merced Municipal Airport (MCE), UC Merced, and Mercy Medical Center and Castle Air Museum. As the Gateway to Yosemite, Merced is 80 miles from the park. Merced offers a variety of entertaining outdoor activities such as hiking and bicycling, as well as water recreation at the many lakes in the area including Lake Yosemite & Don Pedro Lake. From the moment you drive up to the new Holiday Inn Express & Suites in Merced you will feel welcomed by our fresh look and relaxing ambient music. Our responsive staff will help make you comfortable in one of our 91 luxuriously appointed guest rooms, including 19 suites. All rooms are equipped with deluxe new bedding and our Smart Bath Collection, as well as 32 flat panel televisions, and complimentary wired/wireless high-speed Internet. This newly built hotel also features an outdoor pool, whirlpool, exercise room, business center, and a large meeting room. We are confident that your stay with us will be a pleasant experience, so Stay Smart!
